intro: Ruthalicia eglandulosa, commonly known as the smoothleaf ruthalicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are smooth and often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or white in color. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
